To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard.

item.title: Comment on Feel The Flame by garypiggold
item.dc:creator: garypiggold
item.description: <p><img src="http://static.flickr.com/41/110997935_44111214c7_m.jpg" border="0" alt="" width="240" height="86" /></p><p>......and while</p><p>Baby Brother Carl</p><p>was busy</p><p>Flame-ing out,</p><p>the <em>rest </em>of them</p><p>Beached Boys</p><p>got <a href="http://fufkin.com/columns/gold/gary_gold.htm"><strong>down to bizness</strong></a>,</p><p>sorta..... </p><p> </p>
item.content:encoded:
……and while

Baby Brother Carl

was busy

Flame-ing out,

the rest of them

Beached Boys

got down to bizness,

sorta…..

item.title: Comment on cult of the week – Crawling Chaos by jackthrob
item.dc:creator: jackthrob
item.description: More details on "The Gas Chair" and other releases can be found at http://www.crawlingchaos.co.uk/ ...Enough to satisfy the curious and clarify the Factory warblings. This has been set up by an original member of the band, so he should know. And it's not Uncle Harry's Last Freakout, yet.
item.content:encoded: More details on “The Gas Chair” and other releases can be found at http://www.crawlingchaos.co.uk/ …Enough to satisfy the curious and clarify the Factory warblings. This has been set up by an original member of the band, so he should know. And it’s not Uncle Harry’s Last Freakout, yet.

item.title: Comment on Care to Meet Big Boy Pete? by garypiggold

item.content:encoded:
……and

Lest we Forget…..

 

The Perennial Enigma

item.title: Comment on Yellow Balloon by Tony Sclafani
item.dc:creator: Tony Sclafani
item.description: "I've Got a Feeling for Love" and "How Can I Be Down" are also two great yellow Ballooon Songs. I prefer these to the hit. Also, forget Robbie Douglas, whatever happened to Katie, his wife on the show? There was a happenin' chick!
item.content:encoded: “I’ve Got a Feeling for Love” and “How Can I Be Down” are also two great yellow Ballooon Songs. I prefer these to the hit. Also, forget Robbie Douglas, whatever happened to Katie, his wife on the show? There was a happenin’ chick!

item.title: Comment on Lewis Taylor Re-ducks by Shawnte Salabert
item.dc:creator: Shawnte Salabert
item.description: Thought you may like to know that we just received our first official hard copies of the final disc and it is FANTASTIC!!! You're gonna love it - comes out on Jan. 30th. FYI, there is also a Lewis myspace page - www.myspace.com/lewistaylorstoned
item.content:encoded: Thought you may like to know that we just received our first official hard copies of the final disc and it is FANTASTIC!!! You’re gonna love it – comes out on Jan. 30th. FYI, there is also a Lewis myspace page – http://www.myspace.com/lewistaylorstoned

item.title: Comment on Lewis Taylor Re-ducks by mondocali
item.dc:creator: mondocali
item.description: So you have it from a reliable source that Lewis Taylor does in fact have new music in the works? I saw an announcement on the HackTone Records MySpace page that Lewis had retired from the music business and that The Lost Album was going to be a post-career release here in the U.S. That announcement about his retirement was about two months ago. Have things changed since then? I'm going to be optimistic and hope that your sources are reliable, since I love this man's music. The world isn't the same without Lewis' music.
item.content:encoded: So you have it from a reliable source that Lewis Taylor does in fact have new music in the works? I saw an announcement on the HackTone Records MySpace page that Lewis had retired from the music business and that The Lost Album was going to be a post-career release here in the U.S. That announcement about his retirement was about two months ago. Have things changed since then? I’m going to be optimistic and hope that your sources are reliable, since I love this man’s music. The world isn’t the same without Lewis’ music.

item.title: Comment on The Graham Gouldman Thing by djbrian
item.dc:creator: djbrian
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Tony Sclafani.

Hey Tony-

Well, I can’t say I’m surprised to hear that Johnny Ramone wasn’t a 10cc fan. But you’re right, Gouldman is a great story-teller and tune-writer. I love his own version of “No Milk Today” on The Graham Gould Thing. And “Bus Stop” – well, I’ve always thought that was just about the most perfect pop song ever. The opening track on the record, “The Impossible Years,” is another stunning gem of melody and storyline. Having said all of that, it would be fun to listen to Johnny ragging on “I’m Not in Love.”

item.title: Comment on The Graham Gouldman Thing by Tony Sclafani
item.dc:creator: Tony Sclafani
item.description: <p>It's good to see Gouldman be recognized for something other that 10cc and "I'm Not in Love."  His three hits for Herman's Hermits -- "East West," "No Milk Today" and "Listen People," are probably the most soulful and meaningful recordings the band ever did.  His way with a mini-story is equalled by his melodic inventiveness.</p><p>I interviewed Johnny Ramone for my college newspaper in 1985, when The Ramones were on their "Too Tough to Die" tour.  When I asked him about Gouldman (who had produced a previous Ramones LP), it sent him into a semi-comic tirade against how 10cc was wimpy and "I'm Not in Love" was terrible.  I don't think he meant to be mean, but it did show me this is the way a lot of people view Gouldman. I wish I had saved the interview tape.</p>
item.content:encoded:
It’s good to see Gouldman be recognized for something other that 10cc and "I’m Not in Love."  His three hits for Herman’s Hermits — "East West," "No Milk Today" and "Listen People," are probably the most soulful and meaningful recordings the band ever did.  His way with a mini-story is equalled by his melodic inventiveness.

I interviewed Johnny Ramone for my college newspaper in 1985, when The Ramones were on their "Too Tough to Die" tour.  When I asked him about Gouldman (who had produced a previous Ramones LP), it sent him into a semi-comic tirade against how 10cc was wimpy and "I’m Not in Love" was terrible.  I don’t think he meant to be mean, but it did show me this is the way a lot of people view Gouldman. I wish I had saved the interview tape.

item.title: Comment on Meadow House – Tongue Under A Ton of Nine Volters CD (Alcohol) by jimmy_norvegicus
item.dc:creator: jimmy_norvegicus
item.description: i'm actually very disappointed with meadow house's album - wayyy too poppy! i'd hoped that it would be a showcase of his homemade harry partch-style instruments implemented in a bitter anti-music a la epistaxis time (his most recent work, and i enjoy this much more than the hellebore stuff which was five years ago). but it's a joke. i think dan doesn't like people who do drugs and get intoxicated, in fact, i believe he wants to kill them... he is very educated apparently- if epistaxis is to be taken at face value! i am always stalking this elusive character to discover more about this erratic enterprise...
item.content:encoded:
i’m actually very disappointed with meadow house’s album – wayyy too poppy! i’d hoped that it would be a showcase of his homemade harry partch-style instruments implemented in a bitter anti-music a la epistaxis time (his most recent work, and i enjoy this much more than the hellebore stuff which was five years ago). but it’s a joke.
i think dan doesn’t like people who do drugs and get intoxicated, in fact, i believe he wants to kill them… he is very educated apparently- if epistaxis is to be taken at face value!
i am always stalking this elusive character to discover more about this erratic enterprise…
